results.title: Pictures that post
results.creator_credit: Paul Woolston-Smith, Don Murray, Australia Post and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The background to ideas chosen for stamp issues, the source of ideas and how they come to end up on the top righthand corner of most of the three thousand million articles handled each year by Australia Post - that’s the story of this film. Whilst a dozen or more stamp series are issued each year, none has been more successful than the series featuring Australian roses. Both the rose grower and artist, Brian Clinton, feature in the film as well as Deanne Head, one of the three child artists whose designs have been selected for the 1983 Christmas issue. In the film, the stamp designs and the scenes that have inspired them make an informative and entertaining collage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Woolston-Smith, Don Murray, Australia Post and Film Australia

results.title: Pictures teach at Penfield
results.brief_description: Illustrates the role of audio-visual materials in elementary and secondary education by dramatising the teaching methods used at Penfield, New York, Central School District, where films, slides and film-strips are integral parts of the curriculum. The story centres around the reactions of two students, brother and sister, to audio-visual instruction.
results.description: Illustrates the role of audio-visual materials in elementary and secondary education by dramatising the teaching methods used at Penfield, New York, Central School District, where films, slides and film-strips are integral parts of the curriculum. results.title: Pictures out of my life
results.creator_credit: Bozenna Heczko, Wolf Koenig, Canada Dept of Indian Affairs and Northern Development and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The drawings and recollections of Inuit artist Pitseolak, from the book of the same title written by Dorothy Eber. Now in her seventies, Pitseolak is one of the most famous of the graphic artists of the Cape Dorset (Baffin Island) artists’ colony and cooperative. Her coloured pencil and felt-pen drawings vividly illustrate her memories of past life in the Arctic, and of the birds, animals and spirits that figured so large in the daily life of the Inuit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bozenna Heczko, Wolf Koenig, Canada Dept of Indian Affairs and Northern Development and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Pictures of France: Roussillon
results.creator_credit: Max Sautet and French Government Tourist Office
results.brief_description: A rugged landscape compounded of vineyards, rocks and mountains forms the province of Rousillon. At Perpignon, carnival festivities with dancing, masks and fireworks, culminate in a solemn Easter procession through the streets. Traces of various cultural influences remain today in the colour of the bullring and the quaint abbey town with rock-hewn walls and narrow streets. This rich variety of life and architecture makes a painters’ paradise, as ancient traditions are kept alive.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Max Sautet and French Government Tourist Office

results.title: Picture to post
results.creator_credit: Sarah Erulkar, John Durst and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: Several British artists show the processes involved in designing and printing stamps. Design problems and technical printing problems combine to determine the eventual outcome.

results.title: Picture start
results.brief_description: Making a film is only half the battle. Screening it is the other half, especially when there is a resistance from an unexpected quarter, eighth, sixteenth. The result is an amusing struggle with a particularly mischievous film leader. This engaging piece of genuine animation blends both computer generated and cell drawn material.

results.title: Picture palaces
results.brief_description:
Black and white photos of movie houses from Melbourne’s recent past including the State Theatre, Capitol, Regent and Hoyts.

Part One of the project(delivered 3 Sept 2001): documentation of the photographic archive and reproduction onto digital beta.

Palaces in order of appearance:
1. Melba Theatre
2. Liberty Theatre
3. Odeon Theatre
4. Regent Theatre
5. Plaza Theatre
6. Hoyts De Lux - Bourke Street
7. Lyceum Theatre - Bourke Street
8. Capitol Theatre
9. Kings Theatre
10. Savoy Theatre
11. Palace Theatre
12. St James Theatre
13. Metro Theatre - Bourke Street
14. Grosvenor Theatre
15. Athanaeum Theatre
16. The Auditorium Theatre - Collins
17. Metro Theatre - Collins Stree circa 1941
18. Majestic Theatre
19. State Theatre
20. Forum Theatre

results.title: Picture music
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of 20 contemporary rock-video clips. Includes such artists as Kim Carnes, Thomas Dolby, Kim Wilde, The Vapors, Hazel O’Connor Bow Wow Wow, Depeche Mode, The Tubes, Duran Duran and Kate Bush. Each video clip has its own director, no overall director or producer.
